adrFormatAddress: 1221 6th Ave, New York, NY 10020, USA

editorialSummary.text: Open until 4 or 5 am each night, this Middle Eastern food truck prepares halal gyros.

originalText.text: Totally surprised with the food here. We were staying close to Times Square, and were genuinely wondering why such a big line for this food every night. One night, we decided to order in, chicken and falafel spicy rice bowls. The food the damn flavorful and filling. Glad to have tried it during this visit. Would definitely eat here any day.

text.text: Totally surprised with the food here. We were staying close to Times Square, and were genuinely wondering why such a big line for this food every night. One night, we decided to order in, chicken and falafel spicy rice bowls. The food the damn flavorful and filling. Glad to have tried it during this visit. Would definitely eat here any day.

originalText.text: Adel's Famous Halal Food stands out as a culinary gem. The menu is a tantalizing journey through flavorful and authentic halal cuisine. From succulent kebabs to aromatic rice dishes, each bite is a testament to the chef's mastery. The generous portions ensure satisfaction, and the use of high-quality halal ingredients adds an extra layer of authenticity. The friendly service and quick turnaround make it a convenient and delightful choice for those craving delicious halal options. Adel's Famous Halal Food is a must-try for anyone seeking a taste of exquisite halal flavors in a welcoming setting.

originalText.text: Be ready to wait one hour in line but it’s definitely worth it. I was big fan of halal guys for decade but they have become too big with many branches while their prices go up and quality is absolutely horrible. These guys are far better and much better rice and meats and also portion is good amount. Tasty rice and lamb is delicious while sauces are tasty also. Prices are good $9 combo. Beware you will spend some time on the toilet next day as expected but tasty while you eat it, so have your magazine or phone handy.

originalText.text: Simply amazing! Do yourself a favour and line up before opening. We lined up around 5:30pm on this Sunday and the line became extremely long by the 6pm service. We ended up getting our food around 6:15pm and it was well worth the wait. We ordered the combo over spicy rice with white sauce that was so flavourful and fresh. Sauces and seasoning were on point! The staff is extremely friendly, efficient and it’s clear they’re passionate about the food they serve. Local legend for a reason. Keep it up!

originalText.text:
Been hearing about this place for a while and wanted to know what the hype is all about. Being in the vicinity, I finally decided to try out Adel's halal and honestly it was worth it. You'll be greeted by a long waiting line and the wait time exceeds over an hour so one must definitely be patient enough for their turn to grab the food! Even the people passing the cart were asking about what the people were waiting for? Only to be surprised to know about the cart!

Coming over to the food, one can smell its aroma from a little distance and that's where the hunger kicks in, being a cart it definitely doesn't have any ambiance/atmosphere as such or can say the vibe is lively given the location they are based! The service is good and they try to deliver food quickly to you! The best part is they do accept card payment. Initially I had to ask them regarding this before waiting in the line as I didn't carry any cash!

I ordered chicken over a saffron rice platter with fries and sauce on the side. The fries were crispy enough whereas the chicken was nicely marinated in spices and was really flavorful and tender, didn't expect it to be this tasty! The basmati rice was fluffy and moist enough with the right amount of saffron flavor in it whereas the pita bread was really soft but I didn't understand why they put it in the bottom of the platter, took a while to realize it was there! The white sauce was really good too, I don't think I have tasted a better white sauce than this whereas the red sauce was mildly spicy which I felt was the best at least according to my taste buds!

Overall it was a great experience and I did understand why this place currently is on the top of halal cart pyramid than the Halal guys who share a rich legacy about the same in NYC! I hope to try out their spicy rice someday while also hoping they keep their quality intact!
